caption.title: Centrality measures of the air passenger network and number of state transitions.
caption.p: (A) Scatterplot of centrality measures for the air travel network based on degree and betweenness. The “degree” centrality of a given country (node) refers to the number of airlines linking it in the airline network, and the “betweenness” centrality of a given country measures the extent to which a country lies on routes between other countries in airline network (see Methods). The size of each point corresponds to the number of expected Markov jump transitions (including both importations and exportations). (B) Net Markov jump counts, summed across all 3 DENV serotypes. For each country, we summarize the average net Markov jumps (jumps to—jumps from) and their 95% credible intervals. The estimates are ordered from the lowest to highest number of net jumps.
